definitions.text: the principal activity in your life that you do to earn money
examples: he's not in my line of business

definitions.text: a specific piece of work required to be done as a duty or for a specific fee
examples: estimates of the city's loss on that job ranged as high as a million dollars
the job of repairing the engine took several hours
the endless task of classifying the samples

definitions.text: a workplace; as in the expression
an object worked on; a result produced by working
examples: he held the job in his left hand and worked on it with his right
it is their job to print the truth

definitions.text: the performance of a piece of work
examples: she did an outstanding job as Ophelia
he gave it up as a bad job
dry rot did the job of destroying the barn
the barber did a real job on my hair

definitions.text: a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved
examples: she and her husband are having problems
it is always a job to contact him
urban problems such as traffic congestion and smog

definitions.text: a Jewish hero in the Old Testament who maintained his faith in God in spite of afflictions that tested him
any long-suffering person who withstands affliction without despairing
(computer science) a program application that may consist of several steps but is a single logical unit
a book in the Old Testament containing Job's pleas to God about his afflictions and God's reply

examples: the gang pulled off a bank job in St. Louis

definitions.text: profit privately from public office and official business
arranged for contracted work to be done by others

examples: As a student I jobbed during the semester breaks
I bought this house not because I want to live in it but to sell it later at a good price, so I am speculating
